attributes.action: withdraw immediately the proposed Death Tax of £20.000 on the Deceased estate
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
People die that’s natural, it is not natural to place those who are left behind to cope with the death of a loved one under further burden. 

The implementation of a Death Tax on the dead can only be scene as a callus move by the British Government to make money from those who can no longer oppose this un-thoughtful improper tax.
 
This is not a fair tax nor can this tax be applied to all, as many do not have the good fortune that Government Ministers do financially thanks to the British Taxpayer. 

We the undersigned do not request but ORDER the Prime Minister of Great Britain as our Servant as British Taxpayers to withdraw this proposal immediately.
